intro: Boechera holboellii var. secunda, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Boechera holboellii var. secunda is known for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
